conclusion: Analyze the process on the PV diagram and use the definition of work done in thermodynamics.
The process from A to B is an isobaric process because the pressure remains at 1 × 10⁵ Pa.
The volume at state A is 3 L, and at state B, it is 4 L.
The change in volume, ΔV, is 1 L.
For an isobaric process, the work done by the gas is given by W = P ΔV.
Convert the volume change to cubic meters: ΔV = 1 × 10⁻³ m³.
Calculate the work done: W = (1 × 10⁵ Pa) × (1 × 10⁻³ m³) = 100 J.
